result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kodi C. Olson

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation. Filed by Atty Renc.

Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Kodi C. Olson.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are: 21CF334, 21CF-407, 21CF-444, 21CM-304, 22CF-16, 22CF-96, 22CF-97, 21TR-2768, and 21TR-2769. 

3:08 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

This matter is set for a plea hearing today.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Plea offer sheet has been handed out.
21CF-334: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3. Count 2 and Count 4 and Count 5 will be dismissed and read in.
21CF-407: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4 will be dismissed and read in.
21CM-304: Case is dismissed and read in.
21CF-444: Case is dismissed and read in.
22CF-16: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
22CF-96: Case is dismissed and read in.
22CF-97: State moves to dismiss this case outright.
21TR-2768 and 2769: State moves to dismiss cases.

Court questions Atty Dodge regarding the basis for the outright dismissal of 22CF-97.
Parties will be requesting a presentence investigation.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF-334: Count 1: No Contest.
21CF-334: Count 3: No Contest.
21CF-407: Count 2: No Contest.
22CF-16: Count 1:No Contest. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of  21CF-334: Count 1 and Count 3, 21CF-407: Count 2 and 22CF-16: Count 1. 
Domestic abuse charges are clarified. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
21CF-334: Count 2 and Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-407: Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4: Dismissed and read in.
21CM-304: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-444: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-16: Count 2: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-96: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-97: Dismissed outright.
21TR-2768: Dismissed.
21TR-2769: Dismissed.

State has complied with victim rights.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a presentence investigation be produced. 
Presentence be done and filed no later than close of business on August 19th.
If either party has alternative sentencing documents or supporting letters, to be filed by August 26th.
Bond is continued. 

3:40 PM Matters are concluded.
Plea hearing on June 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Matter set for a Plea Hearing on 06/28/2022 at 3:00 p.m.
Matter set for a PTC on 05/31/2022 at 11:00 a.m.  - One last pre-trial before parties decide to set for argued plea/sent hearing or a jury trial
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Matter set for a PTC on 05/16/22 at 10:00 a.m. - Defense is investigating some defenses
sent to DOC Interface on 06/29/22 sp
sent to DOC Interface on 06/29/22 sp

Prior: 2601 Indiana Avenue, Apt. 20, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Cases going to arraignment are 22CF16, 22CF96 & 21CF444.
Information had been filed this morning for 21CF444 and that it mirrors the charges in the criminal complaint.
Atty Renc is okay with proceeding with the arraignments today as long as the Informations mirror the complaints.
Defendant did not receive copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered on all 3 cases listed above. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued on all cases.

10:11 AM Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 21CF334, 21CF407, 21CF444 and 21CM304 and traffic ticket 21TR2769.

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances

ADA Dodge states that 21CF444 is set for an arraigment and the other cases set for pre-trial.
ADA Dodge puts on the record that 21CM294 is actually a felony case.
Clerk re-numbers 21CM294 to 22CF96 and informs the Court.
ADA Dodge states that a preliminary hearing/arraignment will need to be held on 22CF96.
Atty Renc provides the court with waivers of preliminary hearing on 22CF16 and 22CF96 (old 21CM294)

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing to both 22CF16 and 22CF96.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge filed by Atty Anne Renc
Status conference on October 25, 2021 at 03:00 pm.
Comply with all conditions of open bonds.

02:16 PM Defendant Kodi C. Olson appeared by video. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Anne Renc in court for Defendant Kodi C. Olson.  Cases 21CF407, 21CM304, and 21CM294.
  Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Court sets bond on the two CM cases.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued in 21CF407.  Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2021 at 03:00 pm.
